intro: Valeriana tiliifolia, commonly known as the willowleaf valerian, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in terminal clusters, which bloom in late summer. Valeriana tiliifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has mild aromatic properties.
